If you’re scared to speak on camera, read this…

Here’s how to overcome that fear:

1. Stop worrying about others opinions of you. If someone judges you, that’s on them.

2. The only way you fail is if you quit.

3. Speak to 1 person - imagine the camera is a friend who needs your helps the most.

@caseyneistat @loganpaul @emmachamberlain are some of the best people at doing this.

4. Reframe your mindset.

Change how you speak to yourself. The way you speak dictates your energy.

5. Record your videos alone.

Rent a private studio, film when no one is home, etc., become confident filming by yourself first.

6. Keep your videos short.

Keep it concise, simple and clear. Do not add any fluff or make it unnecessarily long.

Earn the attention first.

If you enjoyed this post, hit ‘share’ to share this with your audience on your story!

Hope this helped,
Enrico 🦈

This Filming Trick will change your life! 🤯

When filming with your phone, turn on the grid feature.

This will look like a tic tac toe board on your screen.

This is known as…’The Rule of Thirds’

The Rule of Thirds is incredibly helpful for you when filming or taking photos to properly align your subject within the frame.

If you want a professional looking photo / video, this trick will important for you to understand!

They didn’t care what people thought of them.

They were unapologetically themselves, because that’s all they knew to be.

They let us into their lives and the rest is history.

They created names for themselves and built an incredibly loyal audience that wanted to see them…all the time.

How are you showing up online?

Jersey shore won because they didn’t hide anything, we saw it all, they won on transparency.

You have 3 seconds to get someone’s attention.

The hook is 80% of your video.

SAVE THIS POST! 📌

Meaning,

You should spend a significant amount of time crafting a hook that’s going to stop the scroll and get people to watch.

This is the first thing people hear and it has to deliver.

Here’s 3 you can use to start from this video:

1. Are you (fear derived word) to (outcome)

Ex: Are you petrified to step on the scale?
Ex: Are you terrified to track calories?

2. If you want to (x) try this!

Ex: If you want to lose weight without counting calories, try this!

3. Wanna know what really grinds my gears? (insert controversial topic)

Ex: Wanna know what really grinds my gears? Diet programs promoting eating under 1200 calorie diets.

Hope this helps,

How To Get 10,000 Followers in the next 6 months…

1) Post 1-2x / Day Everyday

No “weekends” off or missing a day. You have to be ruthlessly consistent. “But Christmas is coming up.” And? Post.

2) Create more videos

I trust you if I can see you and hear you in your content. This is why YouTube subscribers are the more valuable audience members, they can see and hear you. Create more videos.

3) Don’t ask for a sale.

I get it, you want to make money. You also don’t want to put people off either. Asking too early automatically labels you as the one who is always selling and not giving. Build up goodwill and give as much away for free.

4) Engage with your audience

Thank people for following you.
Respond to your comments.
It is costing you more than you think not engaging with your audience.

5) Replace scrolling with creating.

Stop the scroll, let the camera roll.

6) Speak to outcomes for your ideal audience.

Make content around outcomes and results your ideal audience member is wanting to create for themselves. It should be replicable & applicable so they can do it immediately.

Hope this helps,
Enrico 🦈

How To Fix Your Videos in 30 seconds! 👇

You’re telling people what to do, not showing them what to do…

If I told you how to do a push up or showed you how to do a push-up, which would be easier for you to replicate?

My guess would favor me showing you.

When you show people how to do something 3 things happen:

1) It’s replicable, they can repeat it and see the same result over and over again

2) It’s applicable, they can apply what you’re showing them immediately to correct a potential problem they had.

3) It’s scaleable, they can share this with a friend, save it, watch it over multiple times, etc.,

Objectively look at your content and pay attention to how often you’re reading from a script to only word vomit information to people vs showing them the information you know so they can apply it in their life.

Hope this helps,
Enrico

Filming Videos with your phone? (Read this 👇)

One of the MOST important features of a video is audio.

This can take your video from being good to great.

Yes, it’s that important.

One of the biggest mistakes I see people making when they’re filming videos with their phone is covering up the microphone.

You’re probably not aware of this.

Most of us tend to film with one arm out and having our pinky rest on the bottom of our phone.

Well, that’s where the microphone is and you’re covering it up.

Or you’re setting your phone on a surface so it’s a more steady shot and you’re also covering the microphone that way too.

There’s a fix for this,

Get yourself a tripod and / or phone clamp so you’re able to free up your microphone and allow for better audio to come through!

This is a super quick fix and makes a world of a difference when it comes to the audio quality on your videos.

How To film HD video with your iPhone! 📱 🤯

1. Go into your settings, under record video, change your filming settings to 4k 24fps. This will ensure you’re filming in the highest quality setting possible.

2. Go into record Slo-mo and change your setting to 1080p at 120fps - this will allow you to have super smooth slowed down shots if you’re filming in the gym, making a recipe, or any type of action you want to make look slowed down!

3. Turn on the grid feature. This will help you understand how to frame your shot and ensure that you’re getting the framing correct and lining things up perfectly.

How To Add Captions to your videos in 80 seconds! 👇

This video is showing you using an app called Capcut (they also have a desktop version too!)

No, this is not sponsored - just a fan of their platform and software for people who are wanting to create videos.

Here’s what to do:

1. Download Capcut
2. Open a new project & import your video
3. Once the video is loaded, hit “text” and hit “auto captions” 
(Now caption are automatically generated for your video)
4. Click on the text and select ‘style’ and select the font you want to use

Also, the font showed in this video is called “The Bold Font” - that is the font people use to generate captions on their videos.

The font I use on most of my videos is called “Montserrat Extra Bold”

You can download both of these and import these fonts into Capcut!

Is it better to film in 4k or 1080p? 🧐 

Put plainly in numbers, 1080p videos contain 1920 x 1080 pixels, and 4K videos contain 3840 x 2160 pixels. 

This means the 4K videos contain about four times the amount of information as 1080p.

Will you notice a difference with 4k vs 1080?

Yes & no.

You would need a device capable of projecting 4k imaging to see the difference.

Filming in 4K takes up 4x more space on your phone and camera vs 1080p.

The main difference you’ll notice is within the frames per second.

This is where you’ll be able to slow down your video, have it look cinematic and have smooth shots.

There’s no right or wrong answer with filming in 4k versus 1080p it comes down to the objective of what your videos about what message you’re trying to portray and how you want it to look.

Hope this helps,
Enrico

The 2-Second Rule (…if you want more views 👇)

Quickly,

Before you go in the comments about attention spans and this editing style destroying our brains and children.

Cartoons never have an image or scene on the tv for longer than 3 seconds.

The 2-second rule:

1. Jump cuts - cut out any fluff, long pauses or filler words that might give someone a reason to continue their scroll and move past your content.

2. Subtitles - 80% of people watch videos with the sound OFF, having subtitles is a great way for people to follow along without needing to hear the sound.

3. Change your tone - tone is everything. Speaking fast or slow dictates the pace and your volume dictates the mood. Be mindful of this.

4. Mini hooks - these are great to keep the viewer engaged and increases curiosity to keep the audience on their toes of what’s to come in your video.

Keep in mind,

You don’t NEED to have constant motion or things popping up, making it cause you to feel overwhelmed and overstimulated.

Find your style and your voice.

Using the 2-second rule works IF you have great content that can amplify the message, not tell it for you.

The distraction test (here’s how it goes) 👀 👇

If you’re not seeing the views and engagement you want on your videos, this is a simple test for you to implement!

Here’s what you’re doing to do:
- grab your phone (if you’re editing on your laptop)
- grab your laptop (if you’re editing on your phone)
- a book
- a pencil
- a pair of headphones
- maybe even your favorite drink

Place these items in front of you.

Now, you’re going to play your video that you’re wanting to post and watch it.

IF AT ANY POINT you look or go to grab one of the items in front of you to distract you, make a note of that.

Pro tip 🔑:

Have someone else in your family watch the video and perform thr test with them!

*Your video is not keeping attention.*

If that occurs, you need to make a change in your video to keep attention because something is wrong.

If you want to 10x your video views INSTANTLY, here’s the simple 4-step framework to follow:

You need to give people a reason to want to watch your videos.

- Open a loop and close it

I haven’t shared this publicly.

2021 & 2022 were tough years for me.

Even a couple months ago when things were “going well”

As someone who had been known for being a videographer and that being my identity, I was transitioning to what I serve people as now in being a Media Strategist.

I didn’t know how to begin creating a new style of content that wasn’t for the people I was working with as a videographer and highlighting them, or make content people wanted to watch or care about.
 I was in my head, constantly.

Every. Single. Day.

I cared what people thought of me.
I cared about my image on social media.
I worried I would be looked at as the opposite of an expert.
I worried that I didn’t know what I was talking about and foolish.

All of the above.

I wanted to quit everything & give up.

All of it.

Sometimes, that happens to this day.

Why am I telling you?

Because I know you go through this too.

Because one piece of content can change your life - whether you’re on the receiving end of watching or giving out content to help change someone watching.

You struggle with speaking on camera.
You struggle with speaking your message.
You struggle with showing up on social media.
You struggle with people judging you some type of way.

Just know, it’s ok.

What’s not ok is quitting.

If you quit, then yes, you’ve failed.

If you don’t quit my friend, you cannot fail.

You have 2 choices:
- Quit
- Keep going

Both are painful, so choose the option you’ll be most proud of yourself for.

Hope this helped,

I left college in 2017 at the age of 21 with 1 year left.

Left it all behind to move my life to Austin, Texas. (Next photo)

I accepted a position to work with Zach Rocheleau, (theflexibledietinglifestyle) worked with him until 2018 before moving to NYC to work for Jordan Syatt for 2 years, to then 3 years later sitting in front of you in Dallas, Texas. (First photo)

Here’s what you didn’t see before I moved,

I dropped out of pre-med & left becoming a doctor at 19, after my first year of college.

It wasn’t my dream anymore, it was my fathers.

It was comfortable, $400,000+/year, the prestige, who wouldn’t?

Me, that’s who.

I hadn’t met Gary Vaynerchuk (yet) and he gave me the permission to leave it all when he said this in a video:

“I would rather you spend the next 2-3 years not pleasing your parents doing YOU, vs the next 80 years resenting them do what they wanted you to do.”

That was the moment.

I had to tell my father I didn’t want “that” anymore.

I lost myself so deep that I attempted suicide because that was easier than building myself up from that.

The default was a communications major to “figure it out” - didn’t know what I wanted but I knew what I didn’t want.

I would watch fitness vlogs like Christian Guzman and wanted to do the same.

Bought a GoPro with the money I saved working at my school’s gym and began filming.

I’d skip class to get time-lapse shots for my vlog because I was obsessed with getting better.

Then, kicked things up a notch..

I competed in the first ever Summer Shredding Competition Christian held (a 90 day challenge from March to June to get shredded for summer) I flew down to Houston, Texas to celebrate with everyone and that’s where I met Zach.

Rest is history.

Listen closely to what I’m going to say here,

You get 1 life - I didn’t want to see it through, so I get it.

Life is too short to live a dream for someone else or to settle.

I guess that’s why I’m a creator at heart, I get to choose the story.

It’s 2023 - life is about creating your own story & building what YOU want.

Just, don’t stop swimming forward, ok?

And be a f*cking shark,
Enrico

The Social Media Cheat Code you need:

Save this. 📌

This is the most simple formula to grow on social media that i & my clients use.

• Learn about your audience and study them

What do they want? What are their desires?

This is your compass to understanding everything about them.

• Understand their problems

What do they struggle with daily? What is limiting or stopping them from reaching their desired outcomes?

• Make content as solutions

Always speak to their outcomes and creatively display why you’re the solution and answer to their problems. Make your content applicable to them and repeatable.

• Engage & interact daily

Respond to comments & direct messages. Have conversations with people. It’s social media, be social.

• Post consistently

Whether that’s daily, weekly, every other day, show up consistently.

• Repeat

There’s your blueprint for growing on social media.

This is the ‘WHY’

- the how

I’ve allowed people to take advantage of me and it was my fault…

When I was younger, I said “yes” to everything.

Yes to every opportunity.
Yes to every job offering.
Yes to doing anything at any moment, at anytime… no matter what.

I had zero boundaries.

And let me be clear, I’m grateful to have been through so many wonderful experiences because they’ve shaped who I am…

However, that’s exactly the issue… they’ve shaped who I am.

I don’t believe in work-life “balance” In my opinion, “balance” doesn’t exist. Boundaries DO, even if you don’t realize it.

I’ve never thought I had boundaries, until I realized I was building resentment.

That’s because deep down, boundaries were, in fact, being crossed.

Let me share a quick story…

When I was working as a videographer a few years ago, I was at my client’s beck and call.

I was ready to serve and ready to work. Always.

I was so “on call” that I would carry my backpack and laptop with me everywhere incase the person I was working for needed something on the spot.

I didn’t realize this was a problem until one day I was asked by my client to complete an “urgent project” on a holiday.

Thinking it was normal to say no… (even though I still had my computer on me), I said, “Hey, I can’t right now, I’m not home. I can have this over to you by tomorrow”

The response shocked me: “No, you’re going to get this to me in the next hour.”

With resentment building, I got my laptop out, completed the project, and sent it within the hour.

This was the start of being scared to tell people “no”.

I went on to live in fear of losing my job & clients if I gave any ounce of pushback.

I still struggle with that today, but it’s something I actively work on.

Last weekend was the 2nd weekend I’ve had “off” in the last 5 years.

And it felt great.

I love working. I love what I do. But I’m allowed to love other things too.

I’m learning to be OK with setting boundaries for projects & deadlines to prioritize myself and how I work best, so I can give my best to my clients.

My advice: Say “yes” early on. Say “no” later. Set your boundaries upfront. Protect your peace.

🦈 - Enrico

1 Idea 5 Viral Hooks! For this video, we’re using Fitness!

Save this video!

1. 99% of (blank) will (desired outcome) if they do this one thing

This hook works well because people don’t want to feel excluded and part of the 1% in this scenario.
Also, “this one thing” creates more curiosity and interest as to what that one thing could be.

2. How I went from (blank) to (blank) in a (specific time) or (area)

Use this as a way to showcase a transformation from where you were to where you are now.
The interest created is in HOW you got there and what you did.

3. How you can brainwash yourself to (blank)
 This is a powerful stance because “brainwashing” is a mechanism often used for a negative connotation and putting a positive spin on this will create interest.

4. “X” tips to increase your (blank) fast

People love numbers and stating that upfront is important so they know what they’re getting into.
People love results - fast results. Give them steps to achieve that.

5. “X” (blank) all (target audience) should avoid

This creates immediately curiosity. People want to know if you’re calling them out on something they’re doing.

My 7-Step Formula for Creating Videos! 🪄 🧙‍♂️ 

1. Idea - having an idea for a video is important so you know what you conceptually are wanting to create.

2. Problem - what problem are you solving with your video?

3. Solution - what is your solution to someone’s problem? What help are you providing in your video? What strategy/hack/tip are you providing?

4. Hook - this is a vital part of your video. you must grab someone’s attention within the first 3 to 5 seconds.

5. Message - you have to confirm to the viewer in this part - the reason they clicked on your video or the reason they stopped scrolling to watch your video is true.

6. Example - can you provide a real life example that the person watching would be facing? This part makes it more simple for the audience to understand.

7. Explanation/CTA - what do you want your audience to do? Also, what is the take home caution message that you want them to leave with?

How To Create a Green Screen Pop up effect in your videos!

SAVE THIS 📌

This style of green screen video gives a more dynamic effect in your videos!

This is using CapCut, here’s what to do:

- open CapCut
- start new project
- import the photo or video you want to use for the green screen style effect
- select ‘overlay’ and import the video of you speaking on camera and scale to fit the screen
- select the clip of you speaking and split that clip
- the right half of the clip is where you’re going to begin the effect (choose wisely)
- select ‘cutout’ and ‘customized cutout’ and draw the effect over yourself
- select the photo or video for the effect and go down to ‘animation’ and select an animation you want to use for this effect!

DONE!

Now you completed the effect!

Add an animation or transition at the end of the effect to transition back to you speaking only!

How the social media algorithms work…(read below 👇)

Excellent podcast and clip with @aliabdaal and @nicolascole77 
(That is the Clip in this podcast)

Whether it’s the Instagram Algorithm, Reels Algorithm, TikTok Algorithm, YouTube Algorithm, etc.,

They all work similarly.

 Meaning, the audience IS the algorithm.

The audience is shown the content and they are the ones who decide if it should pass and grow.

Ex:

- you post an Instagram Reel
- Reel is shown to a select amount of people
- Those people (based off watch time, engagement, etc.,) depending on the positive ratio of engagement and interaction with the content, will then be shown to a larger pool and will continue to do so.

Unless…

If the content reaches a certain threshold or pool of people and the ratio is lower and not enough positive amounts of engagement and interaction, then the content will not continue to grow.

That’s why there’s a ‘cap’ on views vs a video going viral and getting more views.

It becomes a question of: “is this interesting enough to whomever is seeing the content?”

The audience’s get to decide.

That’s how the algorithm works.

Focus on making better content and more interesting content for the audience, not the algorithm.

This is how you will succeed.

Hope this helped,
Enrico 🦈

Trending Audios/Sounds (could be) hurting you…

Trending audios and sounds can be a great way to get more views, and get more reach on your videos.

However…

If you are using a trending audio or trending sound that is owned by a music label or an artist, you no longer on the video, the artist or label does.

It’s like owning an e-mail list vs social media - you have full control of that and access to your contacts vs social media…you don’t.

Here’s why this is a problem…👇

You are now at the mercy of being copyrighted at any given time by a specific artist or label company.

It ‘can’ be great to get more views and more reach, but it is a short term play and can hurt you in the long run.

Yes, trending audios work and trending sounds work.

I have friends who advocate for using them - no issue there!

I caution you to not be surprised if/when a video gets muted, and you used a trending audio/sound.

Even if the video has 1% volume, you’re still using the sound and your original audio will be muted.

Instead, add music in post production so you can keep your video as an original audio and not lose any opportunity for your video to become muted and you can continue to get more views, more reach and more followers.

Hope this helped,
Enrico 🦈

This Instagram Strategy is causing MASSIVE growth. 🤯

I call it the “TV” strategy.

It’s a photo & video swipe post combo.

Also, the first slide act as a thumbnail to generate interest in curiosity from the audience for them to want to watch the video.

I’ve never shared this with you…

I have struggled with food, hard.

(This post isn’t for sympathy, it’s for awareness)

When I first started to learn about weight loss and how to lose weight, intermittent fasting was my gateway.

Intermittent Fasting - essentially - you eat from a specific time 12pm-6pm for example and fast the rest of it.

Does it work? Absolutely. (Cause you’re eating less, it’s not magic)

Did it work because I was eating less calories overall, yes.

However, it started becoming a problem…

I wouldn’t eat with my family on holidays because the food was too calorie dense and didn’t fit in my “eating window”

I would get pissed.

I missed out on a lot of events and time with my family because I was extremely dedicated to intermittent fasting and losing weight as fast as possible.

I experimented with not eating for 36 hours and went as high as 44 hours then I would eat like no other and blackout slam food and ate whatever because “I earned it” from fasting.

In college, I would go to my schools store and buy sweets of all kind to prepare for a 30-40min session of sitting by my tub (the photos are from my apartment) and chew the food for taste, then spit it out into the tub with the water running so it could wash it down and didn’t see the evidence and most importantly, didn’t consume the calories.

I hid this so damn well.

No one knew about this.

I don’t intermittently fast anymore because I’m working on my relationship with food (yes, still to this day)

I wanted to share this with you because of me as a person, it’s deeper than what you see on my page about social media, content and strategy.

I also know and see many people who struggle with food whether from fitness, life, stress, etc., and specifically men who hide this stuff and don’t share it and it never gets addressed.

Like anything, it can become unhealthy and takeover your life and begin having negative effects.

The goal is awareness to ensure the problem doesn’t become worse.

I don’t know who needs to hear this today, I know someone does, that’s for sure.

Hope this helped,

MASSIVE Instagram Reels Update 🚨 (read below 👇)

First, save this video! 📌

Open your analytics on your Instagram Reels…

Then, scroll down to where it shows ‘plays’

You’ll see it shows:
1. Initial plays
2. Replays

Initial plays = someone watches your reel
Replay = same person who watched your reel (fully) is now watching it over again.

Why is this important?

It’s the data showing you what content your audience is most interested in from you.

High initial plays + High Replays = Audience loved it
High initial plays + Low Replays = Audience likes it, but doesn’t care enough to watch again.

If people are watching your reels, and you are getting a high number of replays, that means the audience is interested in your content, and they are spending more time on your page.

This will get you more views, engagement followers, and potentially more revenue/business.

Every 2-3 seconds when you make a video, something needs to happen….

(One of my favorite older videos)

It’s called ‘The 2-Second Rule’

If you want to get more views on your videos and watch time, this is a strategy you can implement!

Here’s some strategies you can use 👇

1) Jump Cuts

Simple, yet hyper effective.

Jump cuts are great to cut out any pauses or filler words in your videos such as:
- “um”
- “like”
- etc.,

Cut those out - you don’t need them.

2) Subtitles

No, you don’t need ‘hormozi-style’ captions.

Captions are a great way for people to follow along on your video AND most people listen to videos with the sound off!

3) Change your tone & pace of voice

The way you communicate and speak with your voice is powerful.

Changing your inflection, tone, pace, etc., the delivery of your messaging with your voice is a powerful tool, use it.

4) Micro Hooks

Micro hooks are a great strategy to re-engage your audience and keep their interest piqued. This keeps things lively and interesting for the audience to want to continue watching.

Give these a try with your next video!

The Best Social Media Strategy for 2024 👀👇

Save this video 📌 

1. Long-Form Video Content

YouTube, Podcasts, Trainings, Webinars, Written Articles, etc.,

Long-Form content allows people to spend more time with you. When people spend more time with you, they trust you more.

2. Micro Content
 This content is pulled from your Long-Form video content and used a ‘clips’ to give the audience a taste of what they can expect in your Long-Form Content and guiding them to watching!

3. Short-Form Video Content

The goal is to create native content that is a condensed version of your long-form content.

4. Online Community

Having an online community is where you will have your ‘hottest leads’ and your ‘raving fans’ because these people are bought into you and want to be further connected to you and other people.

5. Owned Media

You don’t own Instagram.
You don’t own TikTok.
You don’t own X.

You DO own your email list.

Having an email list is crucial to be able to own your contacts and be sure you don’t lose communication with your audience.

Avoid this mistake with your YouTube Shorts…👀

Do not upload YouTube shorts from your desktop or laptop.

Doing this does NOT allow you to select or create a custom thumbnail for your YouTube short.

This is a problem because now YouTube will decide for you what the thumbnail should be and often times, it’s not pretty.

No one is going to watch it. They’ll keep scrolling.

Here’s what you do instead 👇

Upload your YouTube shorts from your phone.

Go through the upload process and right before you finalize uploading your short, tap the pencil icon at the top left and scrub through the timeline of the video to select the thumbnail you want for your YouTube short.

Now, you get to select what the thumbnail is!

That’s it!

Making this small little change will instantly get you more views, and help you grow faster!

Hope this helped,
Enrico 🦈

My Instagram Content Strategy (save this post) 📌 

1) Reels = width & reach new audiences. Reels are (still) a great way to reach people who have never seen your content before.

Follow these practices with Reels:
- keep them concise (not as short as possible)
- trending audios won’t help you get more views

You don’t need to post about 29 different interests you have. Focus on 1 core message for your page.

4) Static posts = ideas to expand on

I call these “atomic ideas” focus on 1 core thing for something you stand for, against, a quick checklist, etc.,

These are great for shares and saves.

Keep. It. Concise.

5) DMs = conversations and sales

Hey, it’s social media, yeah? Be social. 🤯

Talk to someone like you would a human being, not some robot or sales person.

Follow this and you will grow on social media and make money.

Simple.

“The Distraction Test” (read below 👇)

I learned this from Hayden Hiller Smith. (Incredible video editor, and has edited for some of the largest Youtubers.)

You’ll want to save this post. 📌

Here’s how it goes:

The top creators are using this strategy to get them more views on their videos…

Grab a pencil, a book, your phone, your AirPods, anything that would distract you place it in front of you while you are watching your video before posting it.

Play your video and at any point if you go to grab one of those items in front of you that means you are getting distracted.

More than likely, if the audience to watch that video, they would also be distracted and swipe away.

This gives you feedback, so you know at what you need to make changes in your video.

Maybe you need to:
- add a graphic
- sound effect
- cut the music
- make a cut
- rehook the audience
- etc.,

Use the strategy before you post your videos so we can help you determine if it’s a good video or not.

Hope this helped,

How @turkuazkitchen is winning on social media 👇

She’s using 3 elements that might to unnoticed…

First, she uses visual storytelling in her videos to hook you, keep you engaged and stay for more.

Visual storytelling strategies:

1) Make it relatable

Does the audience like this kind of content and can they enjoy it?

2) Audience is the hero

Can the audience see themselves making this product and having the same or similar result as the video?

3) Make it engaging

How are you making it engaging for them to watch the video? Not just once, but multiple times over. (Instagram algorithm loves that)

4) The product is the focus

The product must be great. This is the payoff of the video. The audience must be able to replicate this on their own and win.

Second, she doesn’t use any machinery or electronics in her videos, and this allows her to stand out on social media, because everyone else is doing the exact opposite.

Third, the outfits and attire she’s wearing pay tribute to colonial times,  and aid in the storytelling of this video, especially with not using electronics and tools and doing everything by hand.

She’s also decorating her scenes to match the recipe she’s creating. This is deliberate and helps tell the story of the video.

Find ways for you to use visual storytelling in your videos make sure the audience is the focus, and that the product is great, keep them engaged, use other elements to help tell your story, and you will win!

Trending audios and sounds are (potentially) ruining your videos 👇

When you use a trending audio or sound on your video, you’re running the risk of having your Instagram Reel copyrighted because you don’t own the audio/sound.

This will result in your video getting muted. 🔇 

This has cost me millions and tens of millions of views on my videos because my videos have been muted as a result of using trending audios and sounds.

Trending audios and sounds CAN help you get more reach and views but should not be a strategy for you to rely on.

You should focus on making great content, first.

Then, focus on all the other bells and whistles.

My advice, keep your Instagram Reels as an ‘original audio’ that way you don’t run the risk of your video getting muted and hit with a copyright strike and violation.
